description: From industrial factories to your laundry room, see chemistry at work.

slides.title: Chemistry Uses
slides.content:
# Making Stuff üè≠

Applied chemistry focuses on how chemical principles are used to create products and solve real-world problems.

- Industry
- Consumer Products
- Materials
- Food

slides.title: The Haber Process
slides.content:
# Feeding the World üåæ

Production of Ammonia ($NH_3$) from Nitrogen ($N_2$) and Hydrogen ($H_2$).

$$N_2 + 3H_2 \rightleftharpoons 2NH_3$$

- Uses high Pressure and Temp + Iron Catalyst.
- Used to make **Fertilizer**.
- Sustains 50% of the global population.

slides.title: Polymers and Plastics
slides.content:
# Moldable World üß¥

- **Thermoplastics**: Melt on heating (Recyclable). PET, PE.
- **Thermosets**: Hard on heating (Cannot remelt). Epoxy, Vulcanized rubber.
- **Cross-linking**: Sulfur bridges in rubber make tires tough.

slides.title: Soaps and Detergents
slides.content:
# Cleaning Chemistry üßº

**Surfactants**: Molecules with two ends.
- **Hydrophilic Head**: Loves water.
- **Hydrophobic Tail**: Loves grease/oil.

They form **micelles** around grease, allowing water to wash it away.

slides.title: Electrolysis
slides.content:
# Splitting with Zap ‚ö°

Using electricity to drive non-spontaneous reactions.
- **Chlor-Alkali Process**: Electrolysis of Saltwater ($NaCl$). Produces Chlorine, Hydrogen, and NaOH (Lye).
- **Aluminum Smelting**: Extracting Al from bauxite ore.

slides.title: Process Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: The Haber process produces Ammonia primarily for what use?

slides.title: Batteries
slides.content:
# Portable Energy üîã

- **Primary Cells**: Single use (Alkaline).
- **Secondary Cells**: Rechargeable (Li-ion, Lead-acid).

**Lithium-Ion**: Li ions move from Anode ($C$) to Cathode ($CoO_2$) during discharge, providing lightweight power for phones/cars.

slides.title: Petroleum Refining
slides.content:
# Black Gold üõ¢Ô∏è

Crude oil is a mix of hydrocarbons. Separated by **Fractional Distillation**.

- Top (Cool): LPG, Gasoline.
- Middle: Kerosene, Diesel.
- Bottom (Hot): Asphalt, Tar.

**Cracking**: Breaking big chains into smaller, useful ones (Gasoline).

slides.title: Medicinal Chemistry
slides.content:
# Drug Design üíä

Creating molecules to bind to biological targets (receptors/enzymes).
- **Aspirin**: Modified Willow bark.
- **Penicillin**: Antibiotic from mold.
- **Structure-Activity Relationship (SAR)**: Tweaking molecules to improve efficacy and reduce side effects.

slides.title: Food Chemistry
slides.content:
# Edible Science üçî

- **Fermentation**: Yeast turns sugar to alcohol/CO2 (Bread, Beer).
- **Emulsions**: Mayonnaise (Oil in water).
- **Maillard Reaction**: Browning of meat/bread (Flavor!).
- **Preservatives**: Prevent spoilage (Salt, Sodium Benzoate).

slides.title: Forensic Chemistry
slides.content:
# Crime Scene üîç

- **Fingerprints**: Developed with cyanoacrylate (Super glue).
- **Blood**: Luminol glows with iron in hemoglobin.
- **Breathalyzer**: Redox reaction measures alcohol in breath.

slides.title: Materials Science
slides.content:
# Better Stuff üõπ

- **Ceramics**: Heat resistant, brittle (Tiles, Space Shuttle).
- **Composites**: Carbon Fiber (Strong + Light).
- **Alloys**: Steel (Fe + C), Bronze (Cu + Sn).

slides.title: Nanotechnology
slides.content:
# Tiny Tech ü§ñ

Manipulating matter at 1-100nm.
- **Graphene**: Single layer of carbon. Stronger than steel, conductive.
- **Self-cleaning glass**: Titanium dioxide coating.
- **Drug Delivery**: Nanoparticles targeting cancer cells.

slides.title: Explosives
slides.content:
# Boom üß®

Rapid release of gas and heat.
- **Nitroglycerin**: Unstable liquid.
- **TNT**: Stable solid.
- Nitrogen wants to become $N_2$ gas (very stable) very badly, releasing huge energy.

slides.title: Paints and Coatings
slides.content:
# Color and Protection üé®

- **Pigment**: Color particles ($TiO_2$ for white).
- **Binder**: Glue holding it together (Acrylic).
- **Solvent**: Evaporates to set the paint.

Anti-corrosion coatings save billions in rust damage.

slides.title: Cosmetics
slides.content:
# Looking Good üíÑ

- **Lotions**: Emulsions of oil and water.
- **Sunscreen**: Absorbs UV light ($ZnO$).
- **Hair Dye**: Oxidation reactions.
- Safety and stability are key challenges.

slides.title: Green Technology
slides.content:
# Clean Tech ‚ôªÔ∏è

- **Catalytic Converters**: Turn car exhaust ($NO_x, CO$) into safer gases ($N_2, CO_2$).
- **Water Desalination**: Reverse Osmosis membranes.
- **Hydrogen Fuel Cells**: $H_2 + O_2 \to H_2O$ + Electricity.

slides.title: Applied Chemistry Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Chemistry is the bridge between physics and biology.
- It feeds us (Ammonia).
- It heals us (Drugs).
- It powers us (Batteries/Fuel).
- It builds our world (Plastics/Steel).

Applied chemistry is the engine of modern civilization.
